All Hands Volunteers is a US-based, 501(c)3 non-profit organization that addresses the immediate and long-term needs of communities impacted by natural disasters by engaging and leveraging volunteers, partner organizations and local communities. Our vision is to demonstrate the power and value of volunteer service through the tangible work done, the hope it brings to suffering communities and the transformative experiences it provides for our volunteers. 
What We Do
RESPOND
We respond to the needs of communities impacted by the immediate devastation from natural disasters by engaging and leveraging volunteers, partner organizations and local communities to help homeowners by engaging in activities like “mucking and gutting” after a flood, “rubbling” after an earthquake, or safe demolition for buildings that are dangerous.
RECOVER
We work together with communities to meet their longer term needs by rebuilding the basic 'hubs' of a community, including homes, schools, day care facilities, and community centers.
RENEW
We become part of the fabric of the communities we serve. As we do so, we uncover new ways that we can serve and encourage our volunteers to meet these needs where feasible. Projects have included weekly movie nights for kids in Malawi to offset the devastation with smiles and laughter, holding weekly English tutoring sessions in the Philippines, or hosting a Thanksgiving dinner for hundreds of flood victims in Detroit

Syndicated Loans are loans given to a borrower by multiple Banks. The borrower deals with one single bank (called the Agent bank). The Agent bank liaises between the borrower and various banks participating in advancing the loan (called Participant lenders). Usually the deal is arranged by a bank or a group of banks authorized by the borrower. These banks are called the Lead arrangers and they structure the product based on borrower needs.
In syndication total fund required by the borrower, also called as facility is given in tranches. It is the agent’s responsibility to maintain this facility and tranches and do the drawdown on tranches when requested by the borrower.
Roles and Responsibilities:

Resume.summary:
Currently serving as Vice Chairperson of Scotland Women in Technology where I celebrate, champion and invest in the tech pipeline and community. I also recently spent a year on the Education Advisory Board of The DataLab, Scotland. I am very proud to be able to guide, shape and influence through the power of these forums.
I deliver technology projects for Information Security, managing several workstreams to execute against an agreed Cyber Strategy. As project lead I handle all aspects of the project including on-boarding of suppliers, Legal, Procurement, Compliance, internal governance processes and driving project delivery. My main interests currently lie in IT Security, Big Data, Cyber Intelligence and Innovative Technologies. 
In addition to my day-to-day role I am passionate about encouraging tech sector careers and skills. I led the University, intern and graduate engagements at HSBC's Stirling site and continue to engage with academia to make meaningful connections and introductions. As a STEM ambassador I champion the need for pipeline of young people into technology careers in Financial Services by engaging with students of all ages, from school to university. I have worked closely with Universtity Lecturers, SAS and The DataLab to build academic proposals for Scottish Universities which will aim to fill skills gaps in Data Science and Data Engineering. 
Previously, as a Business Analyst I was involved in a number of projects with HSBC including Server Consolidation, Grid Utilisation optimisation, Streamlining, Cost-saving to name a few.
In 2013 I completed my MSc Business Analysis and Consulting which I passed with distinction. 
In my previous life, I enjoyed nearly 10 years as a serving Police Officer in Strathclyde Police in Glasgow, latterly working in the Intelligence Department. It was here I developed key skills in communication with senior management, detailed and accurate research methods, analysis and report writing.

We host networking events, coordinate external mentoring and share interesting stories and news across our social media channels.
